Very few people making these games know what a truly apolitical game looks like, they're all trying to backpedal into an safe zone of "apoliticism" (read: politics, but only good goy politics) where the gameplay is the only thing that matters. They don't realise that there is no safe zone there, never was a safe zone there, because anything left of (((Trotsky))) is offensive now. And even if they do manage to make a game leftist enough they're only driving the bar further left for everyone after them.
The best way to make an apolitical game now is to make game, then tell marxist niggerkikes to go fuck themselves. Caving gets you nowhere because there is no political safe zone anymore, because there is nothing inherently immune to criticism and these people have nothing meaningful to do but to tear down their betters.

I believe in the existence of forces greater than man, more than he can see with his material senses.
Even if I believe in things that do not exist, they have good and European morals to teach and examples to follow. Believing in no higher order inevitably means to degenerate into soulless niggercattle, which is very good for the kikes who created internationalist Marxist socialism.

>>4cb6b0fb-025b-4bad-876e-14f86f6e2810
>The only thing that Christianity takes from judaism is the chronology and the prophets.
The very idea of an omnipotent, omnipresent, omnibenevolent god is from Judaism. Point to where the same thing occured in any Aryan religion.
>The core is philosophical and logical in the strict sense of the words
And that logic and philosophy is degenerate universalist slave morality, though. Like communism, it gains followers by promising equality for all, and brings everyone down to lower than they were before it.
>But understand that the philosophical foundation of both Greco-Roman and norse mythology is egotism, which naturally leads to solipsism.
How so? In Greco-Roman and Norse mythology, man was not an individual, but a member of a people. People had social roles and responsibilities, such as the pater familias leading the rites of the family, and gods representing social bonds such as these were worshipped. Only under Christianity did Western society degenerate into individualist and solipsist philosophy, these things did not come from the ancient times.
>Where as Christianity is the culmination of stoicism, empiricism, asceticism, and objectivity
>Stoicism flourished throughout the Roman and Greek world until the 3rd century CE, and among its adherents was Emperor Marcus Aurelius. It experienced a decline after Christianity became the state religion in the 4th century CE. t. wikipedia
Empiricism would necessarily demand a god that could be reached and felt. The Romans justified this with every battle they won by rite of devotio, the Norsemen believed likewise that they did not win only through strength, but through a force greater than themselves. Christianity has no such teachings about the presence of their God in men's lives, for all the tales told in the Bible about the manifestations of the Holy Spirit. Other than that, there have been reported sightings of Mary, always of course unverifiable and therefore unempirical.
Asceticism cannot happen in a religion which preaches against war, for war is the greatest form of anti-material asceticism.
Objectivity doesn't happen either, since by claiming the Christian God is objective without first proving his existence without error, one necessarily takes a subjective point of view upon other ideas.
>These ideas are the tools by which one best achieves not only individual, but also societal potential.
Then why has Western society only gotten more and more degenerate since they were introduced?
>inb4 b-but muh jews, they're totally detached from christianity despite us taking most of our religion from the mouth of a jew and still believing in semitic ideas
>there were no christian wars of conquest
(X) Doubt
Edit:
>the ideas themselves were strong enough to conquer the world.
So is judeo-capitalism a good ideology, because it "conquered the world" then? Degenerate shit is easy to sell. Progressivism, communism, Christianity attracted people because all of these things appeal to the numerous weak, telling them that their weakness is no fault of their own and if they follow this prophet they will be equal to their betters. Communism blames the bourgeoisie, progressivism blames white men, Christianity blames the original sin of Adam and Eve. Communism says that equality can be achieved by tearing down the bourgeoisie and living by sharing all resources, progressivism says it can be achieved by getting rid of white men, and then refuses to say any more. Christianity says it can be achieved by following the bible and living your life by its slave morality.
Contrast the ideas of pagans from before this degeneration. You are a human, we are gods, you can share in our power if only you fight well enough to earn it. Yours is the power to be a hero, and the gods cannot but favour heroes. Live without fear, for Valhalla awaits you when you die in glory.
It's no wonder weak semites would try to (((shut it down.))) Holding a heroic philosophy like this needs strength, it requires you to improve yourself rather than to drag everyone else down. Given the current popularity of philosophies of equality instead of philosophies of heroism, I'm sure you can see how Christianity "conquered the world."

>>482dbc43-5ef7-469c-b11a-5c8cf42a9009
>Suffering is something even Jesus endured. Don't conflate modern views of the faith with with its founding saints.
Jesus was God's benevolence coming down to "save" us poor ignorant goyim, that's how it's always been interpreted.
>In the faith, only potential is universal. The faith acknowledges that we're all different, or else to make such a distinction would betray the notion. We are slaves to ourselves, it is only to being enslaved to God can we achieve our potential. 
That's what I mean, it's a religion claiming to be for everybody instead of a national religion reflecting the way the people of a nation think. A slave to himself is a master of himself also, but a slave to a foreign god is truly a slave.
>I argue that such mythologies were the original capeshit of today. mythologies never even attempted to establish social order outside of their creation myths: Its always mortals vs Gods. The myths themselves only established hierarchies among gods, not men.
No, the myths established concepts, qualities that were worth attaining for oneself. The social order was also attested in these myths, and built around the transcendental principles there outlined.
>Not necessarily through the use of logic and metaphysics. Just as a higgs boson is known through its shadow, so do we through His creation
So what proof is there that the creation wasn't the bones and flesh of the jötunn Ymir instead?
>Paul went from a christian slaying moloch worshipping pharisee to having an encounter with Jesus himself. He even has to convince them later on that it wasn't a stunt on his side.
Yes, and? Jews are known for having personality cults based around charismatic rabbis, the structure of which was duplicated in modern times to support jewish pseudosciences like psychoanalysis and cultural marxism despite their obvious fallacies.
>Jesus walked among the high and low, manifesting himself to doubters after his resurrection. This says nothing of the many, as recent as 50 years ago, miracles performed by empowered monks and priests made saints.
>source(s): dude trust me
I bet you believe in the holohoax because people said it happened too.
>Please don't conflate desires for peace for literal pacifism, as there are canons establishing self defense, among other things.
But when have they ever opened themselves to the higher, spiritual aspects of war? Furthermore, where is such reference found in the Bible, the only truly Christian text?
>The choice to believe is up to the individual
Then how can we say God truly wants anything? If he wants his creation to have freedom, he then must not be omnipotent, he must deny himself even the ability to intervene. But the Bible says he is. Does he then not desire his creation's freedom from his own intervention? And if he wants freedom, then why does he also want people to believe in him? If he wants only a certain type of belief why doesn't he just change reality to give everyone that type of belief? The whole mythos collapses once you look at it with objectivity, I can draw out more logical objections if you want.
>Jews, dummy! Notice the lack of Christian monarchs in all of europe and eurasia.
We had Christian monarchs for a long time, and that didn't stop the development of nihilism, atheism, leftism and other """enlightened""" ideas. Then Jews (((coincidentally))) got in in large numbers and ramped up the degeneration. Tradition had already been almost stamped out in favour of a Semitic religion, that the real Semites took advantage of Europe's weakness was only to be expected.
>Use the whole quote: "...with nords or romans..."
That was the whole quote. There were plenty of wars during the Christianization of Scandinavia, such as Olaf I and II's bloodthirsty slaughters, and later the Crusades, pic related.

>Tell that to an addict.
An addict by definition is a slave to something else, which to any sane white man is not a state worthy of being.
>This is a contradiction at best. As I said, hierarchies were only among gods, not men.
In older traditions such as the Vedas the ideas of hierarchy were well-established. These were mostly lost by the time Christianity came, but the Norse still had thralls, freemen and lords, and the Romans still had slaves, freemen, soldiers and nobles, and these were attested in myths.
>Because it takes more faith to believe that than witnesses, compelled by their experiences, to discover and codify a symphony of logic and metaphysics.
>implying there's anything logical about babby's first deviantart oc: yahweh
>Or more succinctly, its why I'm not the one called a larper.
>the one larping about how he wuz yuropeen culcha n shiiet is not a larper
Worse than twitterfags claiming that far-leftist opinions are common decency.
>Except that in every case, those rabbi were exposed for the charlatans that they were.
No they weren't, they carry on even today with the same social structures. At least one sect of Judaism reveres as holy the day on which its founding rabbi escaped the hall of cost.
>Why are you conflating jewish inventions with christian ones?
Because Christianity is a jewish invention and therefore anything European attributed to it is at best a creative misinterpretation of holy text?
>Unlike the holohoax, I don't have anything to gain from debating you like this.
Then why did you start, let alone continue?
>Paul should be a hint that you aren't the first edgy boy to hate on the cross.
wtf i love rabbi yeshua bar yosef now!
>Many allusions to warfighting are made in the new testament. Jesus is said to bring a sword to the world, He himself made a weapon to chase the merchants from the temple, instructed his disciples to purchase swords, and only reprimanded peter against using the sword first.
Where does "turn the other cheek" and "carry a pack two miles instead of one" come into that then? Is there a contradiction in a supposedly divine text?
>Not only that, but contextual exegesis of the gospel is where the christian concepts of self defense and war comes from.
So a misinterpretation then.
>The concept of "Just War" is wholly a Christian one, stemming from the 5th century and evolving ever since.
Then where has it been attested in the Bible? Please cease the larping.
>Technically, the conditions for such have been met for 70 years now, but it should go to show you just how far these jews go in suppressing the true faith from being practice.
Only 70? There have been jews in Europe for hundreds of years now, and before that there were their spiritual brothers the Christians.
And in all this, none of it ever addressed the essential point. Read Metaphysics of War by Julius Evola, or Ride the Tiger if you want a more general philosophy. Evola knew a lot about true European spirituality.
Edit: splitting this into two posts.

Continuation
>Because he himself said it?
<yes goy believe what rabbi yeshua said, this book is the source of all truth™ and metaphysics™
So arrogant you don't even recognise how much of a faggot you look to anyone without their head up their ass.
If an omnipotent being does not have something he must not want it. He has nothing stopping him from getting it, by definition, not even consequences such as faith becoming entrapment because he can take them away, so having must be the same as desiring. The alternative would be to disbelieve in his omnipotence and deny the bible, or to believe in some system of logic which says god can want something but not want it (for itself) at the same time.
>We don't even know the names of all the jewish families who are trying to finance our demise today, with the power of the internet and cooperation. Yet somehow you think this would be an easier feat centuries ago.
Given that Jews have only achieved widespread and blatant financial power in the last 500 or so years, and before that they were restricted in their settlement and generally held accountable for their actions, I'd say it was the Christian subversion of Europe that prepared them to let Jews in. Just like Jews in Spain let Muslims in, Semites work together.
>Olaf was a norse convert who chose to do that to his own people
Nice goalpost move, nerd. Olaf was a Christian conducting war against pagans, which is what you said there were none of. And the Crusades were against European peasants, not armed fighters. Just concede the point, no amount of pilpul can cover up truth.
